name: Introduction to Physics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of basic physics. Students will learn about classical mechanics, electromagnetism, thermodynamics, and modern physics.

name: Classical Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of classical mechanics. Students will learn about the motion of particles, rigid bodies, fluids, and waves in classical physics.

name: Electricity and Magnetism
description: This course introduces students to the principles of electricity and magnetism. Students will learn about the nature of electric and magnetic fields, and their interactions with charged particles.

name: Thermal Physics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of thermal physics. Students will learn about the nature of heat, temperature, entropy, and the laws of thermodynamics.

name: Quantum Mechanics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of quantum mechanics. Students will learn about the nature of the wave-particle duality, uncertainty principle, and quantum states.

name: Plasma Physics
description: This course introduces students to the principles of plasma physics. Students will learn about the nature of plasmas, plasma waves, and their interactions with electromagnetic fields.

name: Advanced Plasma Physics
description: This course introduces students to advanced principles in plasma physics. Students will learn about non-linear plasma phenomena, magnetic confinement fusion, and plasma diagnostics.
